alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 30 at 11:32AM PST until December 30 at 8:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: |. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 5500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the evening commute. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected. * WHERE...San Bernardino County Mountains above 5500 feet. The heaviest snowfall is expected west of the Cajon Pass and above 5500 feet with amounts decreasing toward the east. * WHEN...Until 8 PM today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are occurring. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
